data.title: Excellent service
data.text: Servers personable,  always available, but not intrusive, Food was diverse and prices reasonable. Decor needs update, but not a problem.

data.title: Sunday Brunch at Burbank Bar & Grille.
data.text: It was a great Sunday Brunch at Burbank Bar & Grille, just two weeks before this year's AIDS WALK Los Angeles event at Grand Park in Downtown Los Angeles.

data.title: Just lunch
data.text:
Wonderful late lunch!!!!
Just stopped in and found a gem.  Food was great and staff was friendly.  Nice quiet spot.

data.title: Fun Place ,Live Music
data.text: This place is great with friends and a date. We ate out on the outdoor patio. They had a live person playing guitar. There is a bar with a fireplace to peak the atmosphere. They have a great menu of food to choose from. They also have a live band that plays Eighties music. Good selection of beers and drinks too.

data.title: Average
data.text: Average typical American cuisine. The best thing for me was the thick cut potato wedges. This place is noisy.

data.title: Dinner
data.text:
We tried it for dinner and the food was good 
The atmosphere was good too
Dinner for two We sat outside and it was very good And the place was full

data.title: Love this place
data.text: Love the Bands and Entertainment and the food is awesome too. Right in the heart of Burbank, it's a gem.

data.title: Quality of food varied
data.text: I ate here with a group of about ten. I liked my spinach salad and sweet potato fries, but others did not enjoy their food as much. My main quibble was with how loud the the music was.

data.title: 80s live band on Friday
data.text: My girlfriends and I celebrated here on a Friday night.  If you like 80s music, this is the place for you.  You may eat inside or outside (especially if you want to smoke).  The food is okay, but not bad.  We ate dinner there so we can pick good seats where we can see the band.  The band starts playing at 10pm.  There is a small dance floor which is enough.  I like its relaxed atmosphere.  Parking available on the streets.

data.title: More bar than food
data.text: The food was adequate it was more of a bar atmosphere than a eating establishment for me. The food was OK if I was there for the bar I would give it more stores. The town of Burbank has a lot of food places nearby to check out

data.title: Best Birthday!
data.text: I had my 24th Birthday party here and it went great! I had about 15 guests and they set up a very nice table in the patio area, where they had a duet band with guitar and singer. They were awesome. The party planner helped me make the reservation and everything went great. There food and drinks are good. I recommend the blueberry vodka Stoli for a drink. All my family and friends were happy. They were nice enough to bring out my birthday cake I had brought in. Friendly staff. And there is also a live dj for inside seating and dancing area.

data.title: Good service
data.text:
The Service: Our sever is sweet & personal. Check up on us a few times. Food is served 10 minutes after ordered.

The Food:

The hot wings- cold & dry. Seems like pre-made and sitting in kitchen for long time.

The mushroom flatbread- freshly made. Lots of mushrooms & goat cheese on top.

Nacho- chips were old & still. The guacamole is not house made, tastes like from the jar.

Calamari- small portion, not made to order. Cold..

Sweet potato fries- hot! Freshly made. Big portion for side order.

Mac&Cheese- awful!!! Tasteless!! Not enough seasoning.

The Parking: Street parking & parking structure nearby (free)

data.title: Blah
data.text: Mediocre, uninspiring food.  Small beer list.  Nice outdoor sitting area, but nothing unique.  Everything is "safe".

data.title: What happened?
data.text:
Went there yesterday and met a few friends for Happy hour. I only had drinks but my friends ordered bar food. What a disappointment! the fish and chips was greasy, the shrimp cesar salad tasteless and the ahi tuna looked like a garnish, not an appetizer. No wonder the place was almost empty. It used to better- been there several times . 
It is in a highly visible location so I suppose that is why it still operates but we won't be returning. Even at happy hours prices, not a bargain, the portions are tiny!

data.title: I'd come back here again
data.text:
I like this place.  It's a good place for HH, watching a game and late night fun. 

The food is decent bar food or nonbar food. I ordered the Spicy Shrimp Pasta and it had a slight hint of spicyness to it which I enjoyed a lot.   

When it's game season there's plenty of seating and T.V.'s around and it's very family friendly. 

On a Saturday night there's a band and DJ that switch off every hour so it pleases different guests that come.  Something a little different from the club scene so it's not to crazy.  I believe they charge cover after a certain time, but if you come for dinner then you can bypass that.

data.title: Cool place , good atmosphere
data.text: Cool place , good atmosphere, definitely worth a visit while your in downtown Burbank.  Nice bar with televisions, outdoor patio.

data.title: Great food and drinks.
data.text: I love this place. The burgers are fantastic and the parmesan onion rings are to die for. Great bar food and comfort food. My wife likes the ribs and mac & cheese. Drinks are well made and tasty and there's live music on the outdoor patio.

data.title: Great spot, great atmosphere, good food, AWFUL service.
data.text: Visited this spot in April for a few drinks and a late dinner. We sat upstairs on the patio and there was a great atmosphere up there. It was Open Mic night and that was fun. All of my party were really happy with their meals but the service was absolutely atrocious. We stayed for a few hours afterwards drinking and our server asked us to settle our bill and finish with another server. We didn't mind and hoped for better service with the new server but no such luck. It wasn't overly busy but the servers were just overall slack. I served for a few years myself so I understand how things go wrong but it was a general lack of interest and effort on part of both servers. I don't think I have ever left less than a 20% tip in my life. I left 10% here, it was THAT bad.

data.title: A pretty cool hang out in Burbank
data.text:
Since I'm temporarily based on the Burbank area I have had the chance to explore the local food and drink scene, the Burbank Grill was really a pleasant surprise.

The food is really good, I particularly recommend the BBQ ribs and their Flat Bread Pizzas, drinks are always awesome and they have quite a variety of them, and most importantly the service has always been excellent, the waitresses there have always been really attentive and sweet, always striking a conversation and making recommendations.

Another draw for this bar is the fact that they have a lot of stuff going on, the times i have been there they have had art classes, karaoke, groups on restaurant crawls and Fridays it gets really lively it has one mellow band outside and one playing 80's rock inside, its quite crazy almost looks like a disco more than a bar.

Definitely a nice neighborhood bar, and the best things is that is really close to my place so I can just stumble over there.

data.title: Very casual; everything was good.
data.text:
I was introduced to this place by a group of ladies who worked with one of my relatives.  I met them there, where they sat on the patio and proceeded to drink so many of the specialty martinis (which are very tasty) that they all started flirting outrageously with the poor young bard soloing on the small stage; it was quite embarrassing.  :)

The food was good, although not spectacular in any way.  Also I definitely wouldn't call this an "upscale" bar, it's not even close.  It's not a dive but it's not fancy/nice/high end by any means.  You can go in casual attire (maybe not shorts and tank top but no one would probably care).
